question: How do conventional spherical lenses and Er,Yb glass laser components compare in terms of optical quality and performance?

ground_truth_answer: Conventional spherical lenses suffer from aberration issues where parallel rays fail to converge to the same point, causing blur and dimness at image edges, requiring multiple lens elements to correct. In contrast, Er,Yb glass laser components offer high optical quality with surface flatness of <λ/8@632 nm, wavefront distortion of <λ/4@632 nm, and can emit laser radiation in the eye-safe 1.5-1.6μm range with high efficiency. The Er,Yb glass also features a long fluorescent lifetime of 7.7-8.2 milliseconds and wide absorption band, making it particularly suitable for laser applications.
